title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Torrentpier version 2.4.1 allows executing arbitrary commands on the server.

This is possible because the application is vulnerable to insecure deserialization.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-1651
  • https://fluidattacks.com/advisories/xavi
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5rwm-2xw8-hh9p
items.title: [torrentpier/torrentpier] Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Torrentpier

items.content_html:
Insufficient file size checks resulted in a denial of service risk in the file picker's unzip functionality.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-25978
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2264074
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=455634
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-74641
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/9ba14233597480fb78c04d531050c090de4e60a2
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/a73e0ac76d77b67602f91bb211962813d60bc573
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-487g-3m3v-hjhq
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Uncontrolled Resource Consumption in moodle

items.content_html:
Insufficient checks in a web service made it possible to add comments to the comments block on another user's dashboard when it was not otherwise available (e.g., on their profile page).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-25983
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2264099
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=455641
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-78300
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/4cae44dd0e9a7da47d08d9b75e0ebba0e4b422f4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9r26-5w88-qhp9

items.content_html:
The link to update all installed language packs did not include the necessary token to prevent a CSRF risk.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-25982
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2264098

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7pjp-fm93-p6pj
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Cross-Site Request Forgery in moodle

items.content_html:
Separate Groups mode restrictions were not honored when performing a forum export, which would export forum data for all groups. By default this only provided additional access to non-editing teachers.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-25981
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2264097
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=455637
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-80504
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/1c059cb3fe39da46959e912dc671844dd204e83b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jfrg-9hpq-9hvp
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Improper Access Control in moodle

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Improper Access Control in moodle

items.content_html:
Separate Groups mode restrictions were not honored in the H5P attempts report, which would display users from other groups. By default this only provided additional access to non-editing teachers.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-25980
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2264096
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=455636
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-80501
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/662192fcecdefdaae79f55db96bd64dbcdeef85b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cp8m-h777-g4p3

The URL parameters accepted by forum search were not limited to the allowed parameters.

items.content_html:
Impact

Path disclosure in JavaScript variable

Patches

Patch in PrestaShop 8.1.4

References

https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Full_Path_Disclosure

Thanks to https://github.com/hugo-fasone

References

  • https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/security/advisories/GHSA-3366-9287-7qpr
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-26129
  • https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/commit/444bd0dea581659918fe2067541b9863cf099dd5
  • https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Full_Path_Disclosure
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3366-9287-7qpr
items.title: [prestashop/prestashop] Path disclosure in JavaScript variable
